newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile supermarket group Unimarc issues ADRs Fri.
newsitem.headline: Chile supermarket group Unimarc issues ADRs Fri.

text.p: Chilean supermarket chain Unimarc SA will issue American Depositary Receipts (ADRs) and start trading on Wall Street Friday, said issue underwriter Salomon Brothers.
The company plans to sell 4.5 million ADRs for between $16-18 each -- the final price will be set Thursday.
The group, one of Chile's largest supermarket chains and the second to debut in New York, will also sell shares Friday on the Santiago bourse.
Owned by the Inverraz group, Unimarc hopes to raise around $70 million from the placement to finance plans to double its number of stores in coming years.
The company will be the 20th Chilean firm to start trading in New York.
Supermarket chain Santa Isabel launched on Wall Street nearly two years ago and another supermarket group, D&S, plans to issues ADRs later this year or in early 1998.
